ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] eq cheats website?
ygData.msgSnippet: Amen Brother. Find someone who knows the game, get taught everything you can learn about the game and then run with your knowledge and become knowledgable in
ygData.messageBody:
Amen Brother.
Find someone who knows the game, get taught everything
you can learn about the game and then run with your
knowledge and become knowledgable in the game itself.

Gotta love those 50+ clerics who don't know what
Unrest or Befallen is.

There is so much to the game. I have played for 2+
years and still develop my play style today.


Good Luck

Rob

--- Techpriest <techpriest@...> wrote:
> Quick answer, no I have not seen it. Most of this
> info can be found on web,
> they just lump it one place.
>
> Item locations and quests can be found at
> www.everquest.allakhazam.com
>
> Trade skill info is all at www.eqtraders.com
>
> Maps can be found at www.eqatlas.com
>
> Using Kazaa Lite (not plain Kazaa, it will jack up
> your PC) I found a ton of
> EQ cheat, hack plat-making, etc guides. I
> downloaded some and if they don't
> involve anything illegal I would be willing to post
> them to the files
> section of the group for those that don't want to
> mess with file-sharing
> programs.
>
> For $5 less then the guide you can buy 10,000 plat
> if that is what you want.
>
> Be careful with power-leveling. It is a great way
> to make a high-leveled
> character that is pretty useless. In some games it
> works great since the
> only way to increase skills is to gain a level.
> When people come to EQ they
> do it and end with with a level 30 char with no
> skills. You get 5 points
> for leveling, I normally get 100 - 150 skill points
> while gaining my level.
> How are you going to make up for all those lost
> points? You do boring stuff
> over and over and over, that's how. When I get to
> level 30 I won't need to
> spend hours working my safe fall, bind wounds, or
> dodge, I use them all the
> time.
>
> I am also concerned about the PDFs. How often are
> they updated? I have
> several of the published EQ guides I have gotten
> from book store discount
> racks and much of the stuff in them is flat out
> wrong. The game is always
> changing and the websites change with it, my books
> do not. Do these guides
> get updated with every patch?
>
>
>
